content.description: An alternate of Dame. Instead of taking the overhang head-on start at the same location, but continue more vertically avoiding the overhang. Dame Arbol's only competition for best problem at the crag?
content.protection: 2 pads and a crag dog for emotional support.
content.location: Inbetween Little Big Boy (Left) and Chim Chim Chir-ee (Right).

content.description: Basically I just use this problem to downclimb from the top. You can get your Wide Boys crack fix though by cramming your whole body into the "Offwidth." If my old man can climb it, anyone can.
content.protection: 2 pad minimun Isn't super tall, I just don't 100% trust the rock.
content.location: The furthest left (Southeast from the point) problem.

content.description: Little Pig Boy Comes from the dirt. Between this and Chim Chim Cher-ee I've never done so much rappel cleaning in my Gumby life. Still a decent route, though. I think this was the first "real" rock I climbed.
content.location: In between the Tree (Left) and Tank 7 (Right).

content.description: The obvious line you can see from a ways away. In my subjective opinion, this is one of the most unique climbs in the city. I really wish they could stop lighting fires directly under the overhang. The soot stains and polishes a large portion of the rock, instilling that extra bode of confidence for feet on an already sketchy chossy highball. I'd definitely recommend rap down just to clean before sends. <3
content.location: Located smack dab in the middle of the overhang.

content.description: Quintessential  Missouri (S)Limestone Outcropping. Don't set your expectations too high, but I'm sure we are all used to Missouri's norms. This is a brittle highball so bring ur pads, and a homie or two to break your fall. I've rope soloed and cleaned it every season, to no avail. Proceed with Caution!
